title.line1: 10 years with the worst pain in the world.
title.line2: The dream of flying kept him alive.

hero.subtitle: This is the story of Rafael Regis and our fight so that no Brazilian suffers in silence with rare diseases

aria.support: Support the Rafael Vai Voar movement

story.heading: A Journey of <0>Resilience</0>
story.description: From a dream interrupted to flight regained, discover each chapter of this story that inspired millions and reached the UN

startNightmare.title: The Beginning of the Nightmare
startNightmare.description: At 19, Rafael was a young bodybuilder, newly married and full of dreams. A simple ringing in his ear marked the start of a journey of unimaginable pain.

decadeDarkness.title: A Decade in the Dark
decadeDarkness.description: 10 years of 10/10 pain, 24 hours a day. Over 100 doctors consulted, zero diagnosis. Neuralgia of the intermediate nerve, known as the "suicide disease", pushed every limit.

loveAnchor.title: The Love That Sustains
loveAnchor.description: Luana, his wife, became his anchor. In the darkest moments, when pain felt unbeatable, unconditional love was the light that kept him alive.

worldJourney.title: A Global Journey
worldJourney.description: After years searching, hope emerged in Germany with Dr. Sudhoff. More than 50,000 people worldwide came together to make treatment possible.

lifeSavingSurgery.title: The Life-Saving Surgery
lifeSavingSurgery.description: At UConn Health in the United States, Rafael finally found relief. The complex surgery succeeded, ending a decade of uninterrupted suffering.

patientToAdvocate.title: From Patient to Advocate
patientToAdvocate.description: Rafael turned pain into purpose. Recognized at the UN, the Chamber of Deputies, and the Senate, he now fights for public policies so that no Brazilian suffers in silence with rare diseases.

rafaelWillFly.title: Rafael Will Fly
rafaelWillFly.description: The dream of becoming a pilot, which kept him alive through years of pain, is taking off again. Rafael is back on the simulators, proving no dream is too big when there is hope.

story.quote: "Pain taught me that <0>no dream</0> should die for lack of <0>hope</0>"

brazil.name: Brazil
brazil.detail: For 10 years, Rafael visited hospitals and clinics across Brazil. No doctor could diagnose his rare condition.

germany.name: Germany
germany.detail: In Bielefeld, Germany, Dr. Sudhoff was the first to correctly identify neuralgia of the intermediate nerve and propose a treatment.

usa.name: United States
usa.detail: At the University of Connecticut, the medical team performed the complex surgery that finally freed Rafael from a decade of pain.

un.name: UN - New York
un.description: A global voice for patients living with pain
un.detail: Rafael brought his story to the UN, advocating for global public policies for patients with rare diseases and extreme chronic pain.

manifesto.heading: Our <0>Manifesto</0>
manifesto.description: For a Brazil where no pain is ignored and no dream is destroyed for lack of access to health care
manifesto.quote: "Pain doesn't choose social class,<1/>but <0>treatment</0> does.<1/>That has to <0>change</0>."

universalAccess.title: Universal Access
universalAccess.description: Every Brazilian with a rare disease must have access to specialized treatments, regardless of financial condition.

nationalProtocol.title: National Protocol
nationalProtocol.description: Create a national protocol for extreme chronic pain, ensuring fast diagnosis and appropriate care.

referenceCenters.title: Reference Centers
referenceCenters.description: Establish specialized centers in every region of Brazil to treat rare neurological conditions.

susFastTrack.title: SUS Fast-Track
susFastTrack.description: A priority pathway in SUS for severe cases, removing bureaucracy that can cost lives.

dignityInCare.title: Dignity in Treatment
dignityInCare.description: Humanize care, acknowledging invisible pain and providing integrated psychological support.

join.title: Join this movement
join.description: Your voice matters. By signing this manifesto, you join thousands of Brazilians in the fight for a fairer, more humane health system.
join.signedMessage: Manifesto signed! Thank you for your support.

manifesto.finalQuote: Together, we can turn <0>pain into purpose</0><1/>and <0>suffering into solutions</0>.
